item.description:
Kagoun is a game of confrontation and card development.

In Paris in 1900, while the Universal Exhibition is in full swing, a few spiritism enthusiasts discover the existence of Kagouns. 
These "fantastic" entities are geometric-shaped butterflies of light. From that moment on, these "Kagoun hunters", become obsessed with capturing them and uncovering their "mystery."
The players are these hunters who do everything they can to acquire as many Kagouns as possible, even if it means falling out with their friends. 
They have even formed groups to hunt together and invoke them by "sublimating" them and using their "mystical glasses" to attract them. It's teamwork, but not entirely, as nothing prevents a K-hunter from stealing a Kagoun from their neighbor, turning them into adversaries in the end.

On your turn in a round, you can (1) capture cards (free-roaming Kagouns) or (2) discard cards from your hand (Kagoun targets). 
You can also (3) pair up the cards you have captured or (3) steal a card from your neighbors or opponents. If you capture cards, 
you can have up to 3 pairs of Kagouns in front of you. If you discard, you draw the same number of cards as you discarded. 
If you assemble the cards next to each other, following their shapes, you start accumulating points.
To prevent your opponents from progressing faster than you, you must steal cards from them, but they will defend themselves each time without spending their turn's action. 
All card placements are done face-down.

Some cards also grant you powers that boost your action on your turn in the round. 
To win the game, you must reach 10 assembly points with the bonus point system based on repeating Kagoun symbols. 
You must announce "Kagoun!" and if, at the end of the final round, you have the most points, you win.
